titlestmt.titleproper: [Edcouch] First Baptist Church records, Inclusive: 1941-1974, undated, Bulk: 1949-1952

note.p: © 2021 The Texas Collection. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: Finding Aid was generated by The Texas Collection staff, using the STAR Knowledge Center for Archives (SKCA) task that automatically creates EAD files from the Archive's SKCA catalog records.

did.head: Records Summary
did.abstract: The [Edcouch] First Baptist Church records consist of correspondence and literary manuscripts pertaining to administrative operations of the church.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: [Edcouch] First Baptist Church, originally named Los Indios Baptist Church, was organized during the summer of 1924 in Los Indios, Texas. In 1925 June, after church member Silas Rohr donated a plot of land to the church, the church moved to a new location and changed its name to Adams Tract Baptist Church. In 1927 February the church relocated to a lot in the newly formed and nearby townsite of Edcouch and again changed its name to First Baptist Church of Edcouch. In 1929 March, First Baptist Church of Edcouch licensed its first missionary, a young man named E. Paul Carroll. By 1963, First Baptist Church of Edcouch was one of two churches in the town.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The [Edcouch] First Baptist Church records begin in 1941 and end in 1974. The correspondence series is the largest in the collection and mostly consists of letters regarding church membership from 1949 to 1952. Also included are documents from a five-year progress plan from the 1950s and a flyer advertising the fiftieth anniversary of the organization of the church.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The [Edcouch] First Baptist Church recordswere organized with folder titles and numbers prior to this finding aid, with inventories of the collection and a finding aid. Most of the folder titles already existing were kept.
Currently, the [Edcouch] First Baptist Church records are arranged in two series: I. Correspondence, II. Literary Productions.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: All requests for copying of materials must be submitted to The Texas Collection in writing. Please use the Request Form for Copying Materials sheet. Unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator (s) of this collection are in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

userestrict.head: Use/Re-use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Edcouch] First Baptist Church records, Accession #118, Box #, Folder #, The Texas Collection, Baylor University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Described by Brady Winslow. Released on 2013-06-17.

Archivist''s Notes: Previously, the minute books and membership rolls of First Baptist Church in Edcouch had been part of this collection. In 1998, the church requested that the Texas Collection return the minute books and membership rolls to them. The records were first microfiched and a microform copy was given to the Texas Collection and the originals were returned to the church. The microform copy of these records can be found in First Baptist Church, Edcouch, Texas [microform].

relatedmaterial.head: Related collection materials
relatedmaterial.archref: First Baptist Church, Edcouch, Texas [microform] contains minutes for the church's business sessions from 1924 to 1998, and membership rolls and related materials from 1928 to 1958.

bibref.extref: Garza, Alicia A. “Edcouch, TX.” The Handbook of Texas Online. Accessed 2013 May 16.
Wade, Dorothy. History of the First Baptist Church of Edcouch, Texas. 1952.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: This series is the largest in the collection and contains correspondence relating to church membership of First Baptist Church in Edcouch from 1941 to 1954. This series is in average condition.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: This series contains documents pertaining to a five-year progress plan for First Baptist Church in Edcouch from the 1950s, a flyer advertising the fiftieth anniversary of the church, and other items. This series is in fair to good condition.
